This Technical Specification document provides a comprehensive reference for the {\bfseries{Financial Asset Relationship Database}}, an enterprise-\/grade system designed to visualize and analyze complex interconnections between financial assets across multiple asset classes. This introduction establishes the project\textquotesingle{}s purpose, scope, and context for all stakeholders involved in development, deployment, and utilization of the system.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1780}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{1.\+1 Executive Summary}{1.\+1 Executive Summary}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1780}
\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1781}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{1.\+1.\+1 Project Overview}{1.\+1.\+1 Project Overview}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1781}
The Financial Asset Relationship Database is a sophisticated 3D visualization and analytics platform that enables users to explore interconnected financial assets spanning Equities, Fixed Income (Bonds), Commodities, Currencies, and Regulatory Events. The system features a dual-\/\+UI architecture that accommodates diverse user preferences and deployment scenarios\+:

\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ UI Component   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Technology   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Port   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Target Users    }\\\cline{1-4}
\endhead
Legacy Interface   &Gradio (Python)   &7860   &Python developers, rapid prototyping    \\\cline{1-4}
Modern Interface   &Next.\+js + React   &3000   &Web developers, production deployments    \\\cline{1-4}
REST API   &Fast\+API   &8000   &System integrations, external applications   \\\cline{1-4}
\end{longtabu}


The platform delivers interactive network visualizations powered by Plotly, enabling intuitive exploration of asset relationships through rotation, zoom, and hover interactions. Both frontend experiences share a common backend logic layer ({\ttfamily \doxylink{asset__graph_8py}{src/logic/asset\+\_\+graph.\+py}}) ensuring consistent analytical capabilities regardless of the chosen interface.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1782}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{1.\+1.\+2 Core Business Problem}{1.\+1.\+2 Core Business Problem}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1782}
Financial markets present significant challenges in understanding the complex web of relationships between different asset types. The Financial Asset Relationship Database addresses several critical pain points\+:

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{2}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Challenge   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Solution Provided    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Challenge   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Solution Provided    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endhead
Cross-\/\+Asset Complexity   &Automatic discovery of relationships across asset classes including sector affinity, corporate bond-\/to-\/equity links, commodity exposure, and currency risk    \\\cline{1-2}
Regulatory Impact Analysis   &Integration of regulatory events with scored impact modeling (-\/1 to +1 scale) affecting multiple assets    \\\cline{1-2}
Relationship Visualization   &Interactive 3D network graphs with deterministic layouts (seed=42) for reproducible analysis    \\\cline{1-2}
Portfolio Risk Assessment   &Network metrics calculation including relationship density, average degree, and asset class distributions   \\\cline{1-2}
\end{longtabu}


The system transforms raw financial data into actionable intelligence by surfacing hidden connections that traditional asset-\/by-\/asset analysis would miss.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1783}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{1.\+1.\+3 Key Stakeholders and Users}{1.\+1.\+3 Key Stakeholders and Users}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1783}

The Financial Asset Relationship Database delivers measurable business value through\+:

{\bfseries{Analytical Capabilities\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Cross-\/asset analysis with automatic relationship discovery via {\ttfamily \+\_\+find\+\_\+relationships()} and {\ttfamily build\+\_\+relationships()} methods
\item Real-\/time network statistics with relationship strength normalization (0.\+0-\/1.\+0 scale)
\item Deterministic 3D layouts ensuring reproducible visualizations across sessions
\item Comprehensive schema and business rules documentation generation
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Advantages\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Modern REST API architecture enabling integration with external systems
\item Dual-\/\+UI strategy supporting both rapid prototyping (Gradio) and production deployments (Next.\+js)
\item Thread-\/safe graph initialization with double-\/checked locking for concurrent access
\item JWT-\/based authentication with configurable token expiration (30-\/minute default)
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Operational Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Multiple deployment options\+: local development, Docker containerization, and Vercel serverless
\item Real market data integration via Yahoo Finance API (yfinance)
\item Offline exploration capability using comprehensive sample dataset
\end{DoxyItemize}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1785}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{1.\+2 System Overview}{1.\+2 System Overview}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1785}

The Financial Asset Relationship Database positions itself as a specialized analytical tool for financial professionals who require visibility into cross-\/asset relationships. Unlike traditional portfolio management systems that treat assets in isolation, this platform emphasizes the interconnected nature of financial markets.

The system operates within the broader financial technology landscape, providing\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Network-\/based analysis complementing traditional fundamental and technical analysis
\item Regulatory event integration bridging compliance and investment functions
\item API-\/first architecture enabling ecosystem integration
\end{DoxyItemize}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1788}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Current System Architecture}{Current System Architecture}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1788}

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

The Multi-\/\+Asset Class Data Model provides the foundational domain model supporting five distinct asset classes\+: Equity, Fixed Income (Bonds), Commodity, Currency, and Derivative. Each asset class extends a base {\ttfamily Asset} dataclass with specialized attributes relevant to that financial instrument type.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

This feature enables comprehensive cross-\/asset analysis by providing a unified data structure that captures the unique characteristics of diverse financial instruments while maintaining a consistent interface for relationship discovery and visualization.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Analysts can explore relationships across heterogeneous asset types
\item Portfolio managers can assess diversification across asset classes
\item Data scientists can perform network analysis on a normalized dataset
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

The domain model is implemented in {\ttfamily \doxylink{financial__models_8py}{src/models/financial\+\_\+models.\+py}} using Python dataclasses. The {\ttfamily Asset\+Class} enum defines the five supported types, while specialized dataclasses (Equity, Bond, Commodity, Currency) extend the base {\ttfamily Asset} class with type-\/specific fields. Validation rules enforce data integrity constraints including non-\/empty identifiers, non-\/negative prices, and ISO currency code formatting.

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

Regulatory Event Integration models corporate and regulatory activities that impact multiple financial assets. Events include earnings reports, SEC filings, dividend announcements, bond issuances, acquisitions, and bankruptcy proceedings. Each event carries a scored impact value enabling quantitative assessment of regulatory influence on asset relationships.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

This feature bridges compliance and investment functions by surfacing regulatory events that affect asset valuations and inter-\/asset relationships, enabling proactive risk management.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Compliance officers can track regulatory event propagation
\item Analysts can assess event impact across related assets
\item Portfolio managers can evaluate regulatory risk exposure
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

Implemented via the {\ttfamily Regulatory\+Event} dataclass and {\ttfamily Regulatory\+Activity} enum in {\ttfamily \doxylink{financial__models_8py}{src/models/financial\+\_\+models.\+py}}. The impact\+\_\+score field uses a normalized scale from -\/1.\+0 (highly negative) to +1.\+0 (highly positive). Events link to affected assets via the {\ttfamily asset\+\_\+id} field and optionally through {\ttfamily related\+\_\+assets} for multi-\/asset impacts.

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

The Asset Relationship Graph Engine is the central processing component that discovers, stores, and exposes relationships between financial assets. The engine implements rule-\/based relationship detection across eight relationship types, calculates network metrics, and provides visualization data interfaces.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

This feature transforms raw financial data into actionable intelligence by surfacing hidden connections that traditional asset-\/by-\/asset analysis would miss, enabling superior risk assessment and portfolio construction.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Automatic discovery of non-\/obvious asset relationships
\item Reproducible visualizations via deterministic layouts
\item Network-\/based analysis complementing fundamental analysis
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

Implemented in {\ttfamily \doxylink{asset__graph_8py}{src/logic/asset\+\_\+graph.\+py}}, the engine maintains a graph structure as {\ttfamily Dict\mbox{[}source\+\_\+id, List\mbox{[}Tuple\mbox{[}target\+\_\+id, rel\+\_\+type, strength\mbox{]}\mbox{]}\mbox{]}}. Key methods include {\ttfamily add\+\_\+asset()}, {\ttfamily add\+\_\+regulatory\+\_\+event()}, {\ttfamily build\+\_\+relationships()}, {\ttfamily calculate\+\_\+metrics()}, and {\ttfamily get\+\_\+3d\+\_\+visualization\+\_\+data()}. The engine uses a fixed seed (42) for deterministic 3D layout generation.

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

The REST API provides a comprehensive set of HTTP endpoints for programmatic access to asset data, relationships, network metrics, and visualization payloads. Built on Fast\+API, the API implements Open\+API specification compliance with automatic documentation generation.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

Enables ecosystem integration, allowing external applications and automated workflows to consume financial relationship data programmatically.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Developers can integrate data into custom applications
\item Automated workflows can consume relationship data
\item Third-\/party tools can leverage visualization payloads
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

Implemented in {\ttfamily \doxylink{api_2main_8py}{api/main.\+py}} using Fast\+API 0.\+127.\+0. The API exposes 12 primary endpoints with Pydantic response models for type-\/safe serialization. Graph initialization occurs at startup via the lifespan context manager with thread-\/safe singleton access.

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

The JWT Authentication System provides token-\/based security for API endpoints. Users authenticate via username/password credentials to receive a time-\/limited access token. The system uses HS256 algorithm for token signing with configurable expiration.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

Ensures secure access to sensitive financial data by authenticating API consumers and enforcing token-\/based session management.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Secure programmatic API access
\item Stateless authentication enabling horizontal scaling
\item Configurable session duration
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

Implemented in {\ttfamily \doxylink{auth_8py}{api/auth.\+py}} using Py\+JWT ≥2.8.\+0 and passlib for password hashing. Tokens expire after 30 minutes (ACCESS\+\_\+\+TOKEN\+\_\+\+EXPIRE\+\_\+\+MINUTES). The system requires SECRET\+\_\+\+KEY, ADMIN\+\_\+\+USERNAME, and ADMIN\+\_\+\+PASSWORD environment variables. Failed authentication returns HTTP 401 with "{}\+WWW-\/\+Authenticate\+: Bearer"{} header.

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

CORS Configuration manages cross-\/origin resource sharing policies to enable secure frontend-\/backend communication across different origins. The configuration adapts between development and production modes with support for dynamic origin allowlists and Vercel preview deployments.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

Enables secure browser-\/based API consumption while preventing unauthorized cross-\/origin requests.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Seamless frontend integration
\item Secure cross-\/origin communication
\item Support for preview deployments
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

Implemented in {\ttfamily \doxylink{api_2main_8py}{api/main.\+py}} with environment-\/aware configuration. Development mode permits HTTP localhost\+:3000 and localhost\+:7860. Production mode restricts to HTTPS origins. Vercel preview domains are validated via regex pattern {\ttfamily \texorpdfstring{$^\wedge$}{\string^}https\+://\mbox{[}a-\/z\+A-\/\+Z0-\/9\textbackslash{}-\/\textbackslash{}.\mbox{]}+\textbackslash{}.vercel\textbackslash{}.app\$}. Custom origins are configurable via ALLOWED\+\_\+\+ORIGINS environment variable.

3D Network Visualization renders the asset relationship graph as an interactive three-\/dimensional network using Plotly. Users can rotate, zoom, and hover over nodes and edges to explore asset relationships in an immersive spatial context.

Provides intuitive visual exploration of complex relationship networks that would be difficult to comprehend in tabular form, accelerating insight discovery.

Deterministic layouts use seed=42. Frontend guardrails limit rendering to MAX\+\_\+\+NODES (default 500) and MAX\+\_\+\+EDGES (default 2000).

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

The Metrics Dashboard displays network statistics and distribution analytics including total assets, total relationships, asset class distribution, average degree, maximum degree, network density, and relationship density.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

Provides quantitative insight into network structure, enabling assessment of portfolio diversification and relationship concentration.

\item At-\/a-\/glance network health indicators

\item Relationship concentration metrics
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Description\+:}}

Real Data Fetching integrates with Yahoo Finance to retrieve live market data for a predefined set of symbols. When enabled, the system fetches current prices and attributes for equities, bond ETFs, commodities, and currency pairs.

{\bfseries{Business Value\+:}}

Enables analysis of real-\/world market relationships rather than static sample data, providing actionable insights for production use.

{\bfseries{User Benefits\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Live market data analysis
\item Current price integration
\item Production-\/ready data source
\end{DoxyItemize}

{\bfseries{Technical Context\+:}}

Implemented in {\ttfamily \doxylink{real__data__fetcher_8py}{src/data/real\+\_\+data\+\_\+fetcher.\+py}} using yfinance ≥0.2.\+51. Supported symbols include\+: AAPL, MSFT, XOM, JPM (equities); TLT, LQD, HYG (bond ETFs); GC=F, CL=F, SI=F (commodities); EURUSD=X, GBPUSD=X, JPYUSD=X (currencies). Enabled via USE\+\_\+\+REAL\+\_\+\+DATA\+\_\+\+FETCHER environment variable. Implements atomic JSON file caching via Named\+Temporary\+File and os.\+replace.

\item {\bfseries{Performance Optimizations}}\+: Python 3.\+11 provides approximately 25\% faster execution through specialization improvements, benefiting compute-\/intensive relationship discovery operations.
\item {\bfseries{Ecosystem Compatibility}}\+: The pinned versions of Num\+Py 2.\+2.\+6, Pandas ≥1.5.\+0, and Plotly ≥6.0.\+0 all require Python 3.\+10+ for full feature support.

Type\+Script is selected over plain Java\+Script for the following reasons\+:


\begin{DoxyEnumerate}
\item {\bfseries{API Contract Enforcement}}\+: The frontend consumes strongly-\/typed API responses (e.\+g., {\ttfamily Metrics\+Response}, {\ttfamily Asset\+Response}). Type\+Script ensures compile-\/time validation of response handling.
\item {\bfseries{Plotly Type Safety}}\+: 3D visualization configuration requires precise coordinate arrays and layout objects. Type\+Script prevents runtime errors from malformed visualization data.
\item {\bfseries{React Component Props}}\+: Complex component interfaces for {\ttfamily Network\+Visualization}, {\ttfamily Metrics\+Dashboard}, and {\ttfamily Asset\+List} benefit from explicit prop type definitions.
\item {\bfseries{IDE Productivity}}\+: Type\+Script provides enhanced code completion, refactoring support, and inline documentation in modern IDEs.
\end{DoxyEnumerate}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1921}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{Node.\+js Version Requirements}{Node.\+js Version Requirements}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md1921}
Node.\+js 18.\+0.\+0+ is required for\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Next.\+js 14.\+x App Router architecture
\item Native Fetch API support (no polyfill required)
\item ES Module interoperability
\item V8 engine optimizations for Plotly.\+js rendering
\end{DoxyItemize}

The Financial Asset Relationship Database implements a {\bfseries{layered architecture}} with clear separation of concerns, optimizing for deployment flexibility, maintainability, and appropriate scalability for financial analysis workloads. The system follows an {\bfseries{API-\/first design}} philosophy, enabling multiple presentation layers to consume the same business logic through standardized interfaces.

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Architectural Characteristic   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Design Decision   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Rationale    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Architectural Characteristic   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Design Decision   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Rationale    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
Layer Separation   &Four distinct layers (Presentation, API, Business Logic, Data)   &Enables independent evolution and testing of each concern    \\\cline{1-3}
Monolithic Core   &Single deployable Python process with modular packages   &Simplifies deployment for current scale (\texorpdfstring{$<$}{<}500 assets) while maintaining clear module boundaries    \\\cline{1-3}
API-\/\+First Design   &REST/\+JSON endpoints via Fast\+API with automatic Open\+API documentation   &Universal client compatibility and self-\/documenting interfaces    \\\cline{1-3}
Dual UI Strategy   &Legacy Gradio + Modern Next.\+js frontends   &Supports rapid prototyping and production-\/ready experiences   \\\cline{1-3}
\end{longtabu}
\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2056}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Key Architectural Principles}{Key Architectural Principles}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2056}
The system adheres to the following architectural principles that guide all design decisions\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item {\bfseries{Thread-\/\+Safe Singleton Pattern}}\+: The graph engine uses double-\/checked locking to ensure safe concurrent access during initialization, preventing race conditions under multi-\/threaded workloads
\item {\bfseries{Deterministic Visualization}}\+: Fixed random seed (seed=42) ensures reproducible 3D layouts across sessions, critical for consistent user experience and debugging
\item {\bfseries{Type Safety}}\+: Python dataclasses with validation and Pydantic models enforce strict type contracts throughout the stack
\item {\bfseries{Graceful Degradation}}\+: Fallback mechanisms ensure the system remains operational when external data sources are unavailable
\item {\bfseries{Atomic Operations}}\+: Cache writes use temporary files with atomic rename operations to prevent data corruption
\end{DoxyItemize}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2057}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{System Boundaries and Interfaces}{System Boundaries and Interfaces}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2057}

\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2060}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Primary Data Flow\+: API to Visualization}{Primary Data Flow\+: API to Visualization}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2060}
The primary data flow begins with user interaction and culminates in rendered visualizations\+:


\begin{DoxyEnumerate}
\item {\bfseries{Request Initiation}}\+: User navigates to a page in Next.\+js frontend or Gradio UI
\item {\bfseries{API Communication}}\+: Next.\+js client sends HTTP request via Axios to Fast\+API backend
\item {\bfseries{Security Pipeline}}\+: Request traverses CORS validation → Rate limit check → JWT authentication (if protected)
\item {\bfseries{Graph Access}}\+: API endpoint calls {\ttfamily get\+\_\+graph()} to retrieve thread-\/safe singleton instance
\item {\bfseries{Data Processing}}\+: Graph engine provides assets, relationships, and calculated positions
\item {\bfseries{Serialization}}\+: Pydantic models serialize Python objects to JSON response
\item {\bfseries{Client Rendering}}\+: Frontend receives data and renders Plotly.\+js 3D visualization
\end{DoxyEnumerate}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2061}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Data Ingestion Flow}{Data Ingestion Flow}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2061}
The data ingestion flow populates the graph from external or internal sources\+:


\begin{DoxyEnumerate}
\item {\bfseries{Cache Check}}\+: On startup, {\ttfamily \+\_\+initialize\+\_\+graph()} checks for existing cache at {\ttfamily GRAPH\+\_\+\+CACHE\+\_\+\+PATH}
\item {\bfseries{Cache Loading}}\+: If valid cache exists, JSON-\/serialized graph is loaded directly
\item {\bfseries{Fresh Fetch}}\+: Otherwise, {\ttfamily Real\+Data\+Fetcher} retrieves data from Yahoo Finance (if enabled)
\item {\bfseries{Fallback Mode}}\+: If network unavailable, sample data generator creates representative dataset
\item {\bfseries{Graph Population}}\+: Assets added via {\ttfamily graph.\+add\+\_\+asset()}, events via {\ttfamily graph.\+add\+\_\+regulatory\+\_\+event()}
\item {\bfseries{Relationship Building}}\+: {\ttfamily graph.\+build\+\_\+relationships()} discovers all eight relationship types
\item {\bfseries{Cache Persistence}}\+: Graph serialized to JSON using atomic write pattern
\end{DoxyEnumerate}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2062}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Relationship Discovery Data Flow}{Relationship Discovery Data Flow}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2062}

{\bfseries{Rationale}}\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item {\bfseries{Simplified Deployment}}\+: Single Python process reduces operational complexity for current scale
\item {\bfseries{Module Boundaries}}\+: Clear package structure ({\ttfamily src/logic/}, {\ttfamily src/data/}, {\ttfamily src/visualizations/}) enables future microservices migration
\item {\bfseries{Adequate Scale}}\+: \texorpdfstring{$<$}{<}500 assets fits comfortably in memory with sub-\/millisecond access
\item \texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\+Deployment Flexibility\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\+: Same codebase deploys to Docker, Vercel, and local development
\end{DoxyItemize}

\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\+Tradeoffs\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\+:

\hline

\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Benefit   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Cost    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endhead
Simpler operations   &Limited horizontal scaling of graph    \\\cline{1-2}
Faster development   &All components share runtime    \\\cline{1-2}
Lower latency   &Memory-\/bound capacity   \\\cline{1-2}
\end{longtabu}

The caching strategy uses atomic write operations to prevent data corruption\+:

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Phase   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Operation   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Purpose    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Phase   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Operation   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Purpose    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
1   &Write to {\ttfamily Named\+Temporary\+File}   &Isolate incomplete writes    \\\cline{1-3}
2   &Flush and sync to disk   &Ensure durability    \\\cline{1-3}
3   &{\ttfamily os.\+replace()} atomic rename   &Single atomic operation    \\\cline{1-3}
4   &Delete temp on failure   &Clean up partial state   \\\cline{1-3}
\end{longtabu}

\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2149}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{6.\+1.\+1 Architecture Classification Statement}{6.\+1.\+1 Architecture Classification Statement}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2149}
\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2150}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Applicability Determination}{Applicability Determination}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2150}
{\bfseries{Core Services Architecture is not applicable for this system in the traditional microservices sense.}} The Financial Asset Relationship Database is explicitly designed as a {\bfseries{monolithic layered architecture}} with a single deployable Python process, not as a distributed microservices system.

This architectural decision is documented and intentional, based on the following rationale\+:

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Evaluation Criteria   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ System Characteristic   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Microservices Applicability    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Evaluation Criteria   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ System Characteristic   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Microservices Applicability    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
Deployment Model   &Single Python process   &Not Applicable    \\\cline{1-3}
Service Decomposition   &Modular packages within monolith   &Not Applicable    \\\cline{1-3}
Inter-\/\+Service Communication   &Direct Python function calls   &Not Applicable    \\\cline{1-3}
Service Discovery   &No distributed services to discover   &Not Applicable    \\\cline{1-3}
Data Management   &Shared in-\/memory graph singleton   &Not Applicable   \\\cline{1-3}
\end{longtabu}
\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2151}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Explicit Architectural Decision}{Explicit Architectural Decision}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2151}
The technical specification documents this as a deliberate design choice\+:

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Aspect   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Choice   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Alternatives Considered    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Aspect   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Choice   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Alternatives Considered    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
Deployment Model   &{\bfseries{Monolithic}}   &Microservices, Serverless-\/only    \\\cline{1-3}
API Design   &REST/\+JSON   &Graph\+QL, g\+RPC    \\\cline{1-3}
Data Storage   &In-\/memory with optional persistence   &Database-\/first, Event-\/sourced   \\\cline{1-3}
\end{longtabu}


{\bfseries{Documented Rationale from Architecture Decision Records\+:}}


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item Single Python process reduces operational complexity for current scale
\item Module boundaries enable future microservices migration if needed
\item Dataset size (\texorpdfstring{$<$}{<}500 assets) fits comfortably in memory with sub-\/millisecond access
\item Same codebase deploys to Docker, Vercel, and local development environments
\end{DoxyItemize}\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2152}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{6.\+1.\+2 Monolithic Architecture Overview}{6.\+1.\+2 Monolithic Architecture Overview}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2152}
\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2153}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Layered Architecture Design}{Layered Architecture Design}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2153}

The Financial Asset Relationship Database employs a {\bfseries{hybrid data architecture}} that combines multiple complementary storage mechanisms optimized for different use cases. This design prioritizes in-\/memory performance for real-\/time graph operations while providing optional persistence for durability and scalability.

\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2339}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{6.\+4.\+1.\+1 Executive Security Summary}{6.\+4.\+1.\+1 Executive Security Summary}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2339}
The Financial Asset Relationship Database implements a comprehensive, defense-\/in-\/depth security architecture designed to protect both user identities and financial asset data. The security model centers on JWT-\/based stateless authentication, environment-\/driven secrets management, multi-\/layered input validation, and proactive threat mitigation through rate limiting and CORS controls.

The architecture addresses security concerns across multiple domains\+:

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Security Domain   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Implementation Approach   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Primary Controls    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Security Domain   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Implementation Approach   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Primary Controls    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
Identity \& Access   &JWT with HS256 signing   &Token-\/based authentication    \\\cline{1-3}
Input Validation   &Multi-\/layer validation   &Pydantic models, domain validation    \\\cline{1-3}
Transport Security   &HTTPS enforcement   &TLS termination at edge    \\\cline{1-3}
Rate Protection   &IP-\/based throttling   &slowapi middleware    \\\cline{1-3}
Origin Control   &Allowlist validation   &Environment-\/specific CORS    \\\cline{1-3}
Container Security   &Hardened runtime   &Non-\/root execution   \\\cline{1-3}
\end{longtabu}

The Financial Asset Relationship Database implements {\bfseries{essential monitoring capabilities}} through built-\/in health checks, application logging, and a metrics endpoint. The system follows a {\bfseries{monolithic layered architecture}} that does not require complex distributed tracing infrastructure typically associated with microservices architectures.

The current monitoring implementation provides sufficient observability for the system\textquotesingle{}s operational requirements while maintaining operational simplicity. The following table summarizes the monitoring architecture\+:

The Financial Asset Relationship Database implements a comprehensive multi-\/tier testing strategy designed to ensure reliability, maintainability, and quality across both backend (Python/\+Fast\+API) and frontend (Next.\+js/\+Type\+Script) components. The testing approach emphasizes automated validation at multiple levels—from unit tests validating individual functions to integration tests verifying cross-\/component interactions.

The testing architecture aligns with industry best practices for monolithic layered applications, leveraging pytest for Python backend testing, Jest with React Testing Library for frontend validation, and a robust CI/\+CD pipeline for automated quality gates.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2492}{}\doxysubsubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{6.\+6.\+1.\+2 Testing Philosophy}{6.\+6.\+1.\+2 Testing Philosophy}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2492}

The Financial Asset Relationship Database implements a {\bfseries{dual-\/\+UI architecture}} providing two distinct user interface experiences\+: a legacy {\bfseries{Gradio UI}} for Python-\/native rapid prototyping and a modern {\bfseries{Next.\+js Frontend}} for production-\/ready web deployment. Both interfaces share a common visualization foundation built on {\bfseries{Plotly}} and expose the same underlying graph engine capabilities through different integration patterns.

This architectural decision enables the system to serve multiple user personas—from data scientists who prefer Python-\/centric workflows to enterprise users requiring polished web applications—while maintaining consistency in data visualization and business logic.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2586}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{7.\+1.\+2 UI Architecture Overview}{7.\+1.\+2 UI Architecture Overview}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2586}

\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2674}{}\doxysubsection{\texorpdfstring{8.\+1 Executive Overview}{8.\+1 Executive Overview}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2674}
The Financial Asset Relationship Database implements a {\bfseries{hybrid deployment architecture}} supporting multiple deployment targets to accommodate varying operational requirements. The infrastructure design prioritizes deployment flexibility, operational simplicity, and cost-\/effectiveness while maintaining security and reliability standards appropriate for financial data applications.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2675}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{8.\+1.\+1 Infrastructure Philosophy}{8.\+1.\+1 Infrastructure Philosophy}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2675}
The system follows these core infrastructure principles\+:

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Principle   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Implementation   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Rationale    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Principle   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Implementation   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Rationale    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
{\bfseries{Multi-\/\+Target Deployment}}   &Vercel, Docker, Local   &Supports development through production workflows    \\\cline{1-3}
{\bfseries{Serverless-\/\+First Production}}   &Vercel Edge Functions   &Automatic scaling, global distribution, minimal ops    \\\cline{1-3}
{\bfseries{Container-\/\+Based Portability}}   &Docker with Docker Compose   &Consistent environments across all deployment stages    \\\cline{1-3}
{\bfseries{Infrastructure as Code}}   &Configuration files, no imperative scripts   &Reproducible, version-\/controlled infrastructure    \\\cline{1-3}
{\bfseries{Security by Default}}   &Non-\/root containers, TLS enforcement   &Defense in depth from build through production   \\\cline{1-3}
\end{longtabu}

The graph engine supports eight relationship types with specific detection rules and directionality configurations.

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{3}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Type   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Directionality   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Detection Rule    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Type   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Directionality   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Detection Rule    }\\\cline{1-3}
\endhead
{\ttfamily same\+\_\+sector}   &Bidirectional   &Assets share identical sector value    \\\cline{1-3}
{\ttfamily corporate\+\_\+bond\+\_\+to\+\_\+equity}   &Directional   &Bond {\ttfamily issuer\+\_\+id} matches equity {\ttfamily id}    \\\cline{1-3}
{\ttfamily commodity\+\_\+exposure}   &Directional   &Equity sector linked to commodity type    \\\cline{1-3}
{\ttfamily currency\+\_\+risk}   &Directional   &Asset currency ≠ "{}\+USD"{}    \\\cline{1-3}
{\ttfamily income\+\_\+comparison}   &Bidirectional   &Dividend yield vs bond yield proximity    \\\cline{1-3}

This glossary defines key terms used throughout the Technical Specification, organized by domain.\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2817}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{9.\+2.\+1 Financial Domain Terms}{9.\+2.\+1 Financial Domain Terms}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2817}
\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{2}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Term   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Definition    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Term   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Definition    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endhead
{\bfseries{Asset}}   &A financial instrument with tradeable value. \doxylink{classBase}{Base} domain entity requiring id, symbol, name, asset\+\_\+class, sector, and price fields.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Asset Class}}   &Category classification for financial instruments. Supported values\+: Equity, Fixed Income, Commodity, Currency, Derivative.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Asset Relationship Graph}}   &Core in-\/memory data structure storing assets as nodes and relationships as weighted edges in an adjacency list format.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Average Degree}}   &Network metric representing the mean number of connections per node, calculated as (2 × total\+\_\+relationships) / total\+\_\+assets.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Bidirectional Relationship}}   &A relationship type where the connection applies equally in both directions (e.\+g., same\+\_\+sector, income\+\_\+comparison).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Bond}}   &Fixed income security with specialized attributes\+: yield\+\_\+to\+\_\+maturity, coupon\+\_\+rate, maturity\+\_\+date, credit\+\_\+rating, and issuer\+\_\+id.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Commodity}}   &Asset class representing tradeable goods contracts with attributes\+: contract\+\_\+size, delivery\+\_\+date, and volatility.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Commodity Exposure}}   &Directional relationship linking equity companies to commodity price movements based on sector exposure.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Corporate Bond to Equity}}   &Directional relationship linking bonds to issuing companies via issuer\+\_\+id matching equity id.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Coupon Rate}}   &Annual interest rate paid on a bond\textquotesingle{}s face value, expressed as a percentage.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Credit Rating}}   &Assessment of bond issuer creditworthiness, typically represented as letter grades (e.\+g., AAA, BBB).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Currency}}   &Asset class for foreign exchange pairs with attributes\+: exchange\+\_\+rate, country, and central\+\_\+bank\+\_\+rate.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Currency Risk}}   &Directional relationship for assets with non-\/\+USD currency exposure, indicating foreign exchange risk.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Derivative}}   &Financial instrument whose value is derived from underlying assets. Reserved for future expansion.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Directional Relationship}}   &A relationship type where the connection flows from source to target (e.\+g., corporate\+\_\+bond\+\_\+to\+\_\+equity).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Dividend Yield}}   &Annual dividend payment as percentage of stock price, applicable to equity assets.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Earnings Per Share (EPS)}}   &Company profitability metric calculated as net income divided by outstanding shares.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Equity}}   &Stock/share ownership in a company with attributes\+: pe\+\_\+ratio, dividend\+\_\+yield, earnings\+\_\+per\+\_\+share, and book\+\_\+value.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Fixed Income}}   &Asset class for bonds and debt securities generating regular income payments.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Impact Score}}   &Numerical measure (-\/1.\+0 to +1.\+0) representing regulatory event impact. Negative indicates adverse impact, positive indicates favorable.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Income Comparison}}   &Bidirectional relationship comparing dividend yields to bond yields for cross-\/asset income analysis.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Market Cap}}   &Market Capitalization; total market value of a company\textquotesingle{}s outstanding shares.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Max Degree}}   &Network metric representing the highest-\/connected node in the graph by edge count.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Network Density}}   &Ratio of actual relationships to maximum possible relationships, calculated as total\+\_\+edges / (nodes × (nodes-\/1) / 2).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{P/E Ratio}}   &Price-\/to-\/\+Earnings ratio; stock price divided by earnings per share, indicating valuation.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Regulatory Activity}}   &Enumerated type of corporate or regulatory event\+: earnings\+\_\+report, sec\+\_\+filing, dividend\+\_\+announcement, bond\+\_\+issuance, acquisition, bankruptcy.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Regulatory Event}}   &Corporate or regulatory activity affecting one or more assets with dated occurrence, description, and scored impact.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Relationship Strength}}   &Normalized weight (0.\+0-\/1.\+0) indicating connection intensity between assets in a relationship.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Same Sector}}   &Bidirectional relationship linking assets operating in the same industry sector classification.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Sector}}   &Industry classification for assets (e.\+g., Technology, Energy, Financial Services, Healthcare).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Yield to Maturity (YTM)}}   &Total return anticipated on a bond if held until maturity, accounting for coupon payments and price difference.   \\\cline{1-2}
\end{longtabu}
\hypertarget{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2818}{}\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{9.\+2.\+2 Technical Architecture Terms}{9.\+2.\+2 Technical Architecture Terms}}\label{md__2app_2doc__state_2github__reposRepoArchDocGenContext_2DashFin-FarDb_2financial-asset-relationship-db_2docs_2tech__spec_autotoc_md2818}
\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{2}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Term   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Definition    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Term   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Definition    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endhead
{\bfseries{Adjacency List}}   &Graph data structure where each node stores a list of connected nodes, implemented as Dict\mbox{[}str, List\mbox{[}Tuple\mbox{[}str, str, float\mbox{]}\mbox{]}\mbox{]}.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{App Router}}   &Next.\+js 14 routing paradigm using file-\/system-\/based routing in the app/ directory with React Server Components.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Atomic Write}}   &File operation pattern using Named\+Temporary\+File + os.\+replace() to prevent data corruption during writes.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Bearer Token}}   &HTTP authorization scheme where the token is passed in the Authorization header as "{}\+Bearer \{token\}"{}.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Context Manager}}   &Python pattern using {\ttfamily with} statements for resource management, implemented as session\+\_\+scope() for database transactions.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Dataclass}}   &Python @dataclass decorator providing automatic {\bfseries{init}}, {\bfseries{repr}}, and field handling for domain models.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Dependency Injection}}   &Design pattern where dependencies are passed to components rather than created internally, used in Fast\+API route dependencies.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Double-\/\+Checked Locking}}   &Thread-\/safe singleton pattern checking instance existence before and after acquiring lock to minimize contention.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{\doxylink{classEnum}{Enum}}}   &Python enumeration type for type-\/safe constant values (e.\+g., Asset\+Class, Regulatory\+Activity).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Graph Engine}}   &Core component managing asset relationships, 3D layout calculation, and network metrics computation.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Hybrid Storage}}   &Architecture combining multiple storage mechanisms\+: in-\/memory graph, SQLite auth, optional ORM, and JSON cache.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Layered Architecture}}   &System design separating concerns into Presentation, API, Business Logic, and Data layers for maintainability.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Lifespan Context Manager}}   &Fast\+API pattern for managing application startup/shutdown events using asynccontextmanager decorator.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Middleware}}   &Software layer intercepting requests/responses for cross-\/cutting concerns (CORS, rate limiting, authentication).    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Monolithic Architecture}}   &Single deployable unit containing all application components, as opposed to microservices.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Post-\/\+Init Validation}}   &Dataclass validation in {\bfseries{post\+\_\+init}} method executing after instance creation for business rule enforcement.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Repository Pattern}}   &Data access abstraction providing collection-\/like interface over storage, implemented as Asset\+Graph\+Repository.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Seed Value}}   &Random number generator initialization value (42) for deterministic/reproducible 3D layouts.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Session Scope}}   &Database transaction boundary context manager committing on success, rolling back on error.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Singleton Pattern}}   &Design pattern ensuring only one instance of a class exists, applied to the graph instance with thread-\/safety.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Thread-\/\+Safe}}   &Code safe for concurrent execution by multiple threads without race conditions.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Type Contract}}   &Formal interface defining expected data types through Pydantic models and Type\+Script interfaces.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Wide Table Design}}   &Database schema with nullable columns for type-\/specific attributes in a single table for simpler queries.   \\\cline{1-2}
\end{longtabu}

\tabulinesep=1mm
\begin{longtabu}spread 0pt [c]{*{2}{|X[-1]}|}
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Term   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Definition    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endfirsthead
\hline
\endfoot
\hline
\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Term   }&\PBS\centering \cellcolor{\tableheadbgcolor}\textbf{ Definition    }\\\cline{1-2}
\endhead
{\bfseries{3D Network Visualization}}   &Interactive Plotly-\/based graph rendering with rotation, zoom, pan, and hover capabilities for spatial exploration.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{2D Network Visualization}}   &Flat network view with selectable layout algorithms (spring, circular, grid) for static analysis.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Asset Explorer}}   &Filterable, paginated table view for browsing assets by class and sector with direct detail access.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Color Mapping}}   &Visual encoding scheme mapping asset classes to distinct colors for identification in visualizations.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Hover Text}}   &Tooltip content displayed when cursor hovers over visualization elements showing asset details.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Metrics Dashboard}}   &UI component displaying network statistics including node/edge counts and distribution analytics.    \\\cline{1-2}
{\bfseries{Schema Report}}   &Auto-\/generated Markdown documentation of data models, relationships, and business rules.    \\\cline{1-2}
